IllegalStateException: The specified child already has a parent

Posted by Joshua Mason on 21 January 2016

To be precise, this error reads:

java.lang.IllegalStateException: The specified child already has a parent. You must call removeView() on the childâ€™s parent first.

This is an error I recently came across when trying to get a recycler view to work. At first this can seem a bit confusing, but really it is very simple. Generally it means that youâ€™ve forgotten one tiny detail in your onCreateViewHolder method.

When inflating the layout resource for your view holder, youâ€™ll likely have a line similar to

View view = LayoutInflater.from(parent.getContext()).inflate(R.layout.row, parent);

This is all very well and goodâ€¦ except that using this version of the inflate() method actually tells the layout that it should attach itself to the layout parentâ€¦ Instead we need to tell it not to do this by using

View view = LayoutInflater.from(parent.getContext()).inflate(R.layout.row, parent, false);

The only difference here is we have added a parameter at the end; the boolean â€˜falseâ€™. And that little parameter will solve all your problems! (well, perhaps not all, but at least one)
